titles.title: Geometric Properties of the Cross Products: Illustration

para.para.body: The geometric properties of the cross product operation are used widely. The following illustrations may help you understand them well.

Recall now that the area of a parallelogram is the product of base length and its height. Then the following image explains why the area of the parallelogram spanned by \Vect{x} and \Vect{y} is \Abs{ \Vect{x} } \Abs{ \Vect{y} }\cdot \sin\sphericalangle( \Vect{x} , \Vect{y} ) .
